Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for ~3 months. No bowel movement for 2-3 days, then difficult passage of very hard stool. Associated with abdominal cramps and a bloated, swollen stomach. Abdomen painful when pressed. Eats and drinks normally, but chronic low appetite and underweight status. No recent weight loss. No blood in stool, no change in urination. Regular menses. Tried olive oil which helped soften stool. Family history of sister with ulcerative colitis, but patient's symptoms are different. Underweight status runs in family. Concern: Asks if condition is serious. Request: Wants to know what can be done to soften stool; also interested in future dietician referral for being underweight.
Objective: Abdomen: Distended. Bowel sounds normal. Percussion reveals varying tympani and dampening in the left lower quadrant. Palpation: Sensitive in the left lower quadrant. Non-tender in upper abdomen, right lower quadrant, and renal lodges.
Assessment: Suspected Irritable Bowel Syndrome with constipation (IBS-C). No alarm symptoms noted.
Plan: 1. Prescribe Psyllium fibre sachets. 2. Instruction: Take daily with plenty of water for the next 6 weeks. 3. Safety Netting: Return sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood appears in stool. 4. Follow-up: Re-evaluate in 6 weeks. Discuss dietician referral at that time.
